t: Psalm 147
He Heals the Brokenhearted
Praise*pn the Lord!*s For*ln it is good to sing praises to our God; for*ld it is pleasant, and a song of praise is fitting.
The*ln Lord*s builds up Jerusalem; he*ld gathers the outcasts of Israel.
He*ln heals the brokenhearted and*ld binds up their wounds.
He*ln determines the number of the stars; he*ld gives to all of them their names.
Great*ln is our Lord, and abundant in power; his*ld understanding is beyond measure.
The*ln Lord*s lifts up the humble; he*ld casts the wicked to the ground.
Sing*pn to the Lord*s with thanksgiving; make*ld melody to our God on the lyre!
He*ln covers the heavens with clouds; he*ld prepares rain for the earth; he*ld makes grass grow on the hills.
He*ln gives to the beasts their food, and*ld to the young ravens that cry.
His*ln delight is not in the strength of the horse, nor*ld his pleasure in the legs of a man,
but*ln the Lord*s takes pleasure in those who fear him, in*ld those who hope in his steadfast love.
Praise*pn the Lord,*s O Jerusalem! Praise*ld your God, O Zion!
For*ln he strengthens the bars of your gates; he*ld blesses your children within you.
He*ln makes peace in your borders; he*ld fills you with the finest of the wheat.
He*ln sends out his command to the earth; his*ld word runs swiftly.
He*ln gives snow like wool; he*ld scatters frost like ashes.
He*ln hurls down his crystals of ice like crumbs; who*ld can stand before his cold?
He*ln sends out his word, and melts them; he*ld makes his wind blow and the waters flow.
He*ln declares his word to Jacob, his*ld statutes and rules to Israel.
He*ln has not dealt thus with any other nation; they*ld do not know his rules. Praise*ln the Lord!*s
